variables.name: STORAGE_ID
variables.comment:
* The MTP storage ID of the file
             * @hide

variables.name: FORMAT
variables.comment:
* The MTP format code of the file
             * @hide

variables.name: PARENT
variables.comment: * The index of the parent directory of the file

variables.name: MIME_TYPE
variables.comment:
* The MIME type of the media item. *

* This is typically defined based on the file extension of the media * item. However, it may be the value of the {@code format} attribute * defined by the Dublin Core Media Initiative standard, * extracted from any XMP metadata contained within this media item. *

* Note: the {@code format} attribute may be ignored if the top-level * MIME type disagrees with the file extension. For example, it's * reasonable for an {@code image/jpeg} file to declare a {@code format} * of {@code image/vnd.google.panorama360+jpg}, but declaring a * {@code format} of {@code audio/ogg} would be ignored. *

* This is a read-only column that is automatically computed.

variables.name: TITLE
variables.comment: @removed promoted to parent interface

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE
variables.comment:
* The media type (audio, video, image, document, playlist or subtitle)
             * of the file, or 0 for not a media file

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_NONE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is not an audio, image, video, document, playlist, or subtitles file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_IMAGE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is an image file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is an audio file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is a video file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_PLAYLIST
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is a playlist file.
             *
             * @deprecated Android playlists are now deprecated. We will keep the current
             *             functionality for compatibility reasons, but we will no longer take
             *             feature request. We do not advise adding new usages of Android Playlists.
             *             M3U files can be used as an alternative.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_SUBTITLE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file
             * is a subtitles or lyrics file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_DOCUMENT
variables.comment: * Constant for the {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} column indicating that file is a document file.

variables.name: MEDIA_TYPE_COUNT
variables.comment:
* Constant indicating the count of {@link #MEDIA_TYPE} columns.
             * @hide

variables.name: _MODIFIER
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_INTEGER)

variables.name: _MODIFIER_FUSE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_MODIFIER} column indicating
             * that the last modifier of the database row is FUSE operation.
             * @hide

variables.name: _MODIFIER_CR
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_MODIFIER} column indicating
             * that the last modifier of the database row is explicit
             * {@link ContentResolver} operation from app.
             * @hide

variables.name: _MODIFIER_MEDIA_SCAN
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_MODIFIER} column indicating
             * that the last modifier of the database row is a media scan
             * operation.
             * @hide

variables.name: _MODIFIER_CR_PENDING_METADATA
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_MODIFIER} column indicating
             * that the last modifier of the database row is explicit
             * {@link ContentResolver} operation and is waiting for metadata
             * update.
             * @hide

variables.name: _TRANSCODE_STATUS
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_INTEGER)

variables.name: TRANSCODE_EMPTY
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_TRANSCODE_STATUS} column indicating
             * that the transcode file if exists is empty or never transcoded.
             * @hide

variables.name: TRANSCODE_COMPLETE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_TRANSCODE_STATUS} column indicating
             * that the transcode file if exists contains transcoded video.
             * @hide

variables.name: _VIDEO_CODEC_TYPE
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_INTEGER)

variables.name: REDACTED_URI_ID
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_STRING, readOnly = true)

variables.name: _USER_ID
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_INTEGER, readOnly = true)

variables.name: _SPECIAL_FORMAT
variables.comment: @Column(value = Cursor.FIELD_TYPE_INTEGER)

variables.name: _SPECIAL_FORMAT_NONE
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_SPECIAL_FORMAT} column indicating
             * that the file doesn't have any special format associated with it.
             *
             * @hide

variables.name: _SPECIAL_FORMAT_GIF
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_SPECIAL_FORMAT} column indicating
             * that the file is a GIF file.
             *
             * @hide

variables.name: _SPECIAL_FORMAT_MOTION_PHOTO
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_SPECIAL_FORMAT} column indicating
             * that the file is a Motion Photo.
             *
             * @hide

variables.name: _SPECIAL_FORMAT_ANIMATED_WEBP
variables.comment:
* Constant for the {@link #_SPECIAL_FORMAT} column indicating
             * that the file is an Animated Webp.
             *
             * @hide
